intro: Sebastiania longicuspis, commonly known as the long-crested sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its elongated, spiny leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often red or orange in color. Sebastiania longicuspis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant floral display.
